abstract: Southern Union's shareholders are richer for all the hullabaloo, but the Deal Professor asks whether a better-run process might have produced even more value.
snippet: Southern Union's shareholders are richer for all the hullabaloo, but the Deal Professor asks whether a better-run process might have produced even more value.
lead_paragraph: Examining the fizzled-out bidding war for Southern Union, one is reminded of Shakespeare's tale filled with "sound and fury, signifying nothing."

headline.main: The Fizzled-Out Bidding War for Southern Union
